title: Spiritual Emergence
subtitle: Navigating awakening without losing your ground
description: Spiritual openings can be destabilizing. This course helps you navigate kundalini awakenings, non-dual glimpses, dark nights, and other spiritual phenomena—staying grounded while allowing transformation. Not a replacement for mental health support when needed.

modules.title: Grounding and Stabilization
modules.description: Coming back to earth without shutting down

modules.title: Sustainable Spirituality
modules.description: Building a practice that supports rather than destabilizes

whatYouLearn: Recognize different types of spiritual opening
Use grounding practices that don't shut down awakening
Navigate dark nights and spiritual depression
requirements: Distinction between emergence and emergency—seek clinical help if severely impaired

questions.question: What is the difference between spiritual emergence and spiritual emergency?
options: Emergence is transformative but manageable; emergency involves severe impairment of functioning

questions.question: What is a kundalini awakening?
options: The activation of dormant energy, often causing intense physical, emotional, and energetic symptoms

questions.question: Why is grounding important during spiritual emergence?
options: To maintain functional capacity and integrate experiences without destabilization

questions.question: What is the 'dark night of the soul'?
options: A spiritual stage involving loss of meaning, dryness, and sometimes despair—often preceding deeper opening

questions.question: How should non-ordinary experiences be approached?
options: With openness and discernment, integrating meaning without becoming attached or ungrounded

questions.question: What makes spiritual practice sustainable?
options: Practices matched to your current capacity with attention to integration and grounding
